name: intercoastal
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
happening, positioned, or operating between different coasts (= the land at the side of the sea): They fish for cod and rockfish in the rough intercoastal waters. It looked as though the government intended to foster inter-coastal shipping at the expense of the railroads.
More examplesFewer examplesA federal law requires coastal and inter-coastal traffic to be carried in US-built and registered ships.There's been an increase in traffic that moves up rivers and intercoastal waterways.Waterways behind the houses lead out to the intercoastal waterways that surround the city.
